alert.note: Alert for Carroll (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 12:54PM EST until December 19 at 5:51PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... New Hampshire... Saco River At Conway affecting Cumberland, Carroll and Oxford Counties. Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Belknap and Merrimack Counties. Lamprey River Near Newmarket affecting Rockingham and Strafford Counties. Warner River At Davisville affecting Merrimack County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Merrimack River AT Goffs Falls affecting Rockingham, Hillsborough and Merrimack Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Saco River at Conway. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Floodwaters continue to recede. At 9.0 feet, Flooding of low-bottom fields and private roads in Conway and North Conway. Minor flooding in Transvale Acres, Moat Brook Bridge, and the lower part of E. Road flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:45 AM EST Tuesday was 17.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 4.6 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
